attributes.action: Make HSE & Gas Safe investigate the failure of engineers to meet legal standards
attributes.additional_details:
The Health and Safety Executive & Gas safe must be held to account and do their job to ensure Gas Safe registered engineers:

1} are competent to complete a full, safe boiler service, with regular checks on performance 

2} have a legal minimum service time

3} complete a clear, detailed report

4} are held to account in the same way as other professions which potentially risk peoples lives

5} HSE & Gas Safe should complete random checks on standards of work & update the registration process.
attributes.background: A recent Which? investigation showed that engineers had failed to provide boiler servicing which is safe and meets legal minimum requirements for the job. Of the 6 'big companies' and 4 independent companies checked 70% failed to meet minimum legal requirements.

rejection.details:
Gas Safe is not a public body, so the Government and Parliament couldn't require it to take these actions. The HSE is a public body, but it is an independent regulator, so it is not directly controlled by the Government and Parliament.

You could start a new petition calling for the HSE to be given new powers or responsibilities by law.
